title: Red Sox reportedly place reliever Jordan Hicks on IL after latest implosion
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox place reliever Jordan Hicks on 15-day injured list due to shoulder injury before game against Diamondbacks.
Hicks, acquired in trade from Giants, holds an 8.20 ERA over 21 appearances with Boston after recent poor performance.
Left-handed pitcher Chris Murphy is expected to join the Red Sox bullpen in place of the injured Hicks.

title: Derrick White gets candid about ‘different’ season that awaits Celtics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics face a 'bridge season' in 2025-26 after losing key players to trades and free agency.
Jayson Tatum's Achilles injury sidelines him for the entire 2025-26 season, impacting the Celtics' competitiveness.
Derrick White discusses challenges of adapting with new players and uncertain roles amid significant roster changes.

title: Report of suspicious man approaching Arlington child ‘unfounded,’ police say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Arlington police closed the investigation into an alleged child approach, determining the report was 'unfounded.'
An 11-year-old claimed a masked man in a vehicle tried to grab him on Waldo Road, but he escaped.
Police Chief Julie Flaherty stated insufficient evidence was found after interviews and surveillance footage review.

title: Man who threatened pro-Palestinian protesters in Cambridge facing assault charge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matthew Freeman of North Billerica is charged with assault and battery with a dangerous weapon in Cambridge District Court.
Freeman allegedly brandished a hatchet and threatened pro-Palestinian protesters in Cambridge, calling them "Nazis" and using homophobic slurs.
The state's CAIR chapter is representing Fawaz Abusharkh, who claims Freeman struck him with a car door during the incident.

title: Patriots’ Will Campbell lands on injury report ahead of season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell, rookie left tackle for the Patriots, is listed as a limited participant with an ankle injury.
Christian Gonzalez is expected to miss the season opener due to a hamstring injury sustained in July.
Patriots may rely on backup tackles Vederian Lowe or Marcus Bryant against the Raiders if Campbell can't play.

title: Invasive seaweed stinks up one of the North Shore’s favorite seaside spots
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Invasive seaweed, heterosiphonia japonica, causes a rotten egg smell at Good Harbor Beach, Gloucester.
Hurricane Erin's strong winds washed large amounts of seaweed ashore, leading to decomposing odors.
First found in 2008, the seaweed now extends from Nova Scotia to Long Island's south shore.

title: Police: Suspect caused ATM explosion in Woburn, prompting FBI investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: An ATM exploded at an Eastern Bank in Woburn, reportedly due to a pipe bomb or unidentified device.
FBI and State Police Bomb Squad are investigating the ATM explosion that occurred around 9 a.m. Thursday.
The suspect fled the scene and remains at large; there were no injuries reported, according to police.

title: Canton man arrested in Dorchester murder
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Jordan Evans, 32, was arrested in Canton for the May 3 murder of Shakar Caterson in Dorchester.
Shakar Caterson, 35, was shot near Blue Hill Avenue and Georgia Street, and later died at a hospital.
Evans faces charges including murder and firearm violations, with arraignment pending in Roxbury Municipal Court.

title: New England governors back wind energy as Trump escalates his attacks on industry
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: New England governors, including Maura Healey, urge the Trump administration to uphold offshore wind permits to support clean energy.
President Trump's administration has halted construction on key projects like Revolution Wind, affecting Connecticut and Rhode Island.
A lawsuit by northeastern states against Trump's order suspending new offshore wind leasing was allowed to proceed by a judge.

title: Read a statement from the fiancé of Shrewsbury father shot and killed after walking son to school
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Kevin Doherty, 56, was shot on a bridge in Shrewsbury on Aug. 28 after walking his son to school.
Doherty's fiancé, Sarah Schofield, released a statement expressing gratitude for community support during their loss.
A community vigil and fundraiser for Doherty will be held on Oct. 11 at SAC Park in Shrewsbury.
